location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Political Department letter no. 8 from James Pringle Riach, Acting Resident, Bushire to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter concerns the loss of the baglow [buggalow] of Syeed Hamza, Prince of Johanna [Nzwane], which was plundered near the village of Bordaghan. Riach praises Hamza and his people for the consideration they had always shown towards British vessels that landed in their country, and asks the Governor to sanction the expenses that had been incurred by the Residency supporting Hamza and his followers.Enclosed with this letter is a statement of expenses of Syeed Hamza, Prince of Johanna and his six followers from 30 December 1825 to 28 February 1826, signed by James Pringle Riach, Acting Resident, Bushere [Bushire] Residency and dated 28 February 1826.
